result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --To pay $154.47 restitution, payable to Pick n Save, Watertown- joint & several

--pay costs of $443 (includes DNA); due in $25 increments per month beginning 4/1/17 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 5 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, without Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being

Court finds that the Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program and requests that he continue with those programs in prison

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

Notation on Envelope: Inmate not Here
Criminal case settlement w/attachments

Cases 15CM319 & 15CM321 called together at 3:27 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Anthony D Miller in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on 15CM321; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM319

On 15CM321, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, without Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $443 (includes DNA); due in $25 increments per month beginning 4/1/17 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 5 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--To pay $154.47 restitution, payable to Pick n Save, Watertown- joint & several

Court finds that the Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program and requests that he continue with those programs in prison
Recess: 3:50 pm
defendant from DCI for the 1/22/16 hearing

Status conference at 01-22-2016 03:15 pm

Case called at 2:00pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Donald Hassin Jr. presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Anthony Miller appears via video conferencing from Dodge County Jail, in custody. 
Attorney David Zarwell appears in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant can see the Court; the Court can see Defendant. But neither have audio

Atty. Zarwell indicates that resolution is likely, requests plea/sentencing date.
video connection lost at 2:07pm

video connection regained at 2:09pm---the Court is able to hear Mr. Miller; Mr. Miller unable to hear the Court
The Court schedules a Status Conference.
A writ is to be prepared for Mr. Miller's personal appearance.
recess: 2:13pm

NEXT: Status Conference on 1/22/16 at 3:15pm ((writ to be prepared))
State's with Cover Letter

Proposed order to produce.  Per DA's office, a video appearance is fine so the writ does not need to be processed. (JA, Br4)

Cases 15CM319 & 15CM321 called together at 9:13 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Anthony D Miller appears in custody, via video, with Attorney David Zarwell, who appears in Court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

BOTH CASES: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

-No acts or threats of violence
-No presence at 304 N. Water St. or Pick -n-Save, Watertown
-Booking at JCSD

15CM321: Court requires a $200 CASH bond with conditions:

Cases 15CM319 and 15CM321 called together at 2:00pm [mo]
Defendant Anthony D Miller appears via video conferencing from the Dodge County Jail , in custody.
Atty. David Zarwell appears in the courtroom on behalf of Mr. Miller 
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zarwell files a substitution of Judge 
--the Court grants the substitution in both cases


The Court does NOT find that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient, since Mr. Miller was unable to hear the court proceedings. 
Atty. Zarwell indicated that he will notify Mr. Miller of the court proceedings today
recess: 2:03pm
